肥.definition: fat; fertile; loose-fitting or large; to fertilize; to become rich by illegal means; fertilizer; manure

肥城市.definition: Feicheng, county-level city in Tai'an 泰安市[Tai4an1 Shi4], Shandong

肥大.definition: (of clothes) baggy; loose; (of a person) fat; stout; (medicine) hypertrophy

肥實.definition: plump (of fruit); fat (of meat); fertile (of land)

肥東.definition: Feidong, a county in Hefei 合肥[He2fei2], Anhui

肥東縣.definition: Feidong, a county in Hefei 合肥[He2fei2], Anhui

肥水不流外人田.pinyin: féi shuǐ bù liú wài rén tián
肥水不流外人田.definition: lit. don't let one's own fertile water flow into others' field; fig. keep the goodies within the family (proverb)

肥田.definition: fertile land; to fertilize the soil

肥碩.definition: fleshy (fruit); plump; large and firm-fleshed (limbs, body); stout

肥羊.definition: (fig.) attractive and easy mark; source of steady profit; moneymaker; cash cow

肥肉.definition: fat (e.g. pork fat); fatty meat; (fig.) a gold mine; cash cow

肥膘.definition: body fat, esp. the layer of fat under the skin (used in reference to humans, animals or meat)

肥西.definition: Feixi, a county in Hefei 合肥[He2fei2], Anhui

肥西縣.definition: Feixi, a county in Hefei 合肥[He2fei2], Anhui

肥馬輕裘.definition: lit. stout horses and light furs; fig. to live in luxury
